keyTakeaways: 成功之路很少是笔直的——要接受混乱并继续前进
现金流，而不是利润，几乎要杀死大多数企业

summary_short: Phil Knight 的Nike创业回忆录读起来像是一部冒险小说。从用汽车出售鞋子到建立全球品牌，Knight 揭示了几乎破产、背叛和突破。关于运气、失败以及形象与现实之间的差距，他的坦率令人耳目一新。
summary_medium:
Why This Book Matters

Nike is now ubiquitous, but its founding story is harrowing: constant cash crises, lawsuits from partners, a Japanese supplier playing games. Knight's candid account demystifies entrepreneurship and celebrates the people who made Nike possible.

The Early Days

Knight started by importing Japanese running shoes, selling them at track meets from his car. The economics were brutal: banks wouldn't lend, suppliers demanded payment, growth ate all profits.

Building the Team

Knight's 'Buttfaces' (his inner circle) were misfits who believed in the cause: a running coach, an accountant, an overweight salesman. Their loyalty sustained the company through crises.

Going Public

Nike's IPO solved the cash crisis but created new pressures. Knight reflects on what was gained and lost when a scrappy startup became a corporate giant.
